title: Create /etc/wsl-distribution.conf
description:
Create the distribution configuration file that controls first-run experience.

Required settings:
- oobe.command: path to OOBE script
- oobe.defaultUid: 1000
- oobe.defaultName: "cachyos" or "cachyos-wsl"
- shortcut.enabled: true
- shortcut.icon: path to .ico file (max 10MB)
- windowsterminal.enabled: true
- windowsterminal.profileTemplate: path to terminal profile JSON

File must be owned by root:root with permissions 0644.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] /etc/wsl-distribution.conf created
- [ ] All required fields configured
- [ ] File permissions set to 0644
- [ ] File owned by root:root

title: Research CachyOS branding assets
description:

1. Locate official CachyOS icon/logo (for .ico conversion)
2. Find official brand colors for Windows Terminal profile
3. Check if there's a CachyOS brand guide
4. Identify any existing Terminal color schemes

Document where to get assets and what colors to use.

title: Create OOBE first-run script
description:
Create the Out Of Box Experience (OOBE) script that runs on first launch to set up a user account.

The script should:
- Check if user with uid 1000 already exists
- Prompt for username
- Create user with uid 1000
- Add user to appropriate groups (wheel, sudo, etc.)
- Set user as default in /etc/wsl.conf
- Prompt for password
- Return 0 on success (non-zero blocks shell access)

Reference the sample script in build-custom-distro.md.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] OOBE script created (e.g., /etc/oobe.sh)
- [ ] Script is executable
- [ ] Script creates user with uid 1000
- [ ] User added to sudo/wheel groups
- [ ] Default user set in /etc/wsl.conf
- [ ] Script handles existing user gracefully

title: Create/obtain CachyOS icon file
description:
Create or obtain an icon file for the Start Menu shortcut.

Requirements:
- .ico format
- Maximum size: 10MB
- Should represent CachyOS branding

Icon will be referenced in /etc/wsl-distribution.conf shortcut.icon setting.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Icon file in .ico format
- [ ] File size under 10MB
- [ ] Icon placed in appropriate location (e.g., /usr/lib/wsl/)

title: Create Windows Terminal profile template
description:
Create a JSON template file for Windows Terminal profile customization.

The template should define:
- Color scheme (optional, can use CachyOS branding colors)
- Font settings
- Antialiasing mode
- Other visual preferences

Do NOT include 'name' or 'commandLine' as WSL auto-generates these.

Reference: /en-us/windows/terminal/json-fragment-extensions
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Terminal profile JSON created
- [ ] Valid JSON format
- [ ] Does not include 'name' or 'commandLine' fields
- [ ] Color scheme matches CachyOS branding (optional)

title: Create PowerShell test script
description:
Create a PowerShell script (override-manifest.ps1) for local testing that:
1. Computes SHA256 hash of the .wsl file
2. Creates a local distribution manifest JSON
3. Sets registry key to override WSL distribution list
4. Enables testing with `wsl --install test-distro`

Reference the sample script in build-custom-distro.md lines 336-370.

After testing, the registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\\SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\Lxss\\DistributionListUrl should be deleted.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] PowerShell script created
- [ ] Script requires admin privileges
- [ ] Script generates manifest.json
- [ ] Script sets registry override
- [ ] Instructions for cleanup included

title: Create /etc/wsl.conf for systemd settings
description:
Create the per-distribution configuration file /etc/wsl.conf.

Decide whether to enable systemd by default:
- [boot]
  systemd=true|false

If systemd is enabled, must disable/mask problematic units:
- systemd-resolved.service
- systemd-networkd.service
- NetworkManager.service
- systemd-tmpfiles-* services
- tmp.mount

File must be owned by root:root with permissions 0644.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] /etc/wsl.conf created
- [ ] systemd setting configured
- [ ] If systemd enabled, problematic units masked
- [ ] File permissions set to 0644
- [ ] File owned by root:root

title: Obtain CachyOS root filesystem tar
description:
Research and obtain a CachyOS root filesystem. Options:
1. Use Docker to export a CachyOS container (docker export)
2. Use official CachyOS bootstrap/rootfs if available
3. Build from scratch using CachyOS tools

The rootfs should contain all base CachyOS binaries and files needed for a functional system.
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] CachyOS root filesystem obtained
- [ ] Filesystem contains necessary base packages
- [ ] Root user exists with uid=0 in /etc/passwd
- [ ] No password hashes in /etc/shadow
- [ ] No /etc/resolv.conf included
- [ ] No kernel or initramfs included
notes:
Research completed. Found existing CachyOS-WSL project (https://github.com/okrc/CachyOS-WSL) with complete implementation including:
- Docker-based build using cachyos/cachyos image
- Rootfs generation via rootfs-gen.sh script
- WSL-compliant cleanup (removes /etc/resolv.conf, masks systemd services)
- Professional OOBE with locale detection and keyring init
- Pre-built releases available

Decision: Build our own implementation to learn the process, using CachyOS-WSL as reference for best practices but not copying directly.

Approach: Use Docker method with official cachyos/cachyos image to create rootfs, implementing our own build scripts.

title: Build custom distro
description:
Create a custom CachyOS WSL distribution following Microsoft's .wsl format (WSL 2.4.4+). This involves:

1. Obtaining/creating a CachyOS root filesystem tar file
2. Creating WSL configuration files (/etc/wsl-distribution.conf and /etc/wsl.conf)
3. Creating an OOBE (out of box experience) script for first-run user setup
4. Optionally creating a Windows Terminal profile template
5. Packaging as a .wsl file (renamed tar file)
6. Testing locally using registry overrides
7. Optionally distributing via manifest or file sharing

The final deliverable is a .wsl file that users can install via `wsl --install --from-file` or by double-clicking.
design:
Based on Microsoft WSL documentation:
- Use tar-based distribution format (not appx)
- Root filesystem should be gzip-compressed tar
- Configuration files define default behavior, OOBE experience, shortcuts, and Terminal integration
- Distribution can be tested locally before wider distribution
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] CachyOS .wsl file is created
- [ ] File can be installed via wsl --install --from-file
- [ ] OOBE script successfully creates user on first run
- [ ] Distribution appears in Start Menu with custom icon
- [ ] Windows Terminal profile is generated
- [ ] systemd is properly configured (if enabled)

title: Package rootfs as tar.gz file
description:
Package the CachyOS root filesystem with all configuration files into a tar.gz archive.

Use the recommended command:
```bash
cd /path/to/rootfs
tar --numeric-owner --absolute-names -c * | gzip --best > ../install.tar.gz
```

Important:
- Root of tar should be root of filesystem (not a directory containing it)
- Use gzip compression (best compatibility)
- All config files must be included and properly configured
acceptance_criteria:
- [ ] Tar file created with all rootfs contents
- [ ] Gzip compression used
- [ ] Tar root is filesystem root
- [ ] All WSL config files included
- [ ] OOBE script included and executable
- [ ] Icon file included (if applicable)
